ExpSyntax.val: 'RP04_ How Do I Define Page Header and Footer Information?'

Text.val: The Data Source fields that will be used in the report
Here the year is isolated from the date, so it can be used in a control break.
Fields for totalling at each break

TXT.val: For each record, one detail line is printed, and the amount is totalled
for the summary fields. If this was a Summary report, the Detail line
would not be printed, but the totalling would still be done in this section

Text.val: And add this amount to our totals.

TXT.val: Groups are used for the Control Breaks in the report.
Here the breaks are by Category and Year, with a group header for Category.
For this to work right, the data must be sorted by Year, then Category.
That is done in Task-> Sort (Ctrl+T).

Text.val: Output the total by category, then zero it out.
Output the total by year, and zero out the total.

_Comment.valUnicode: The Page Header prints automatically at the top of each page, because it is specified in Task I/O Properties (Ctrl+I).
The Page Footer prints automatically at the bottom of each page, because it is specified in Task I/O Properties (Ctrl+I).

The Category Header and Footer are output manually, in a Group logic unit.
Note the ordering of the Forms. The two page forms come first, then the two category forms, then the Date forms, and last, the Detail line. Yet when you view the Forms, they are displayed in approximately the same order that they will be printed in.
This grouping is done using the Class property. As long as the Forms all have the same Class, they will be viewed together. Also, the headers that are "above" the current header being printed will automatically be re-printed when they need to be, at the top of a new page.

At the lowest level is the Detail line, the line that will print once for each record.
Note that it is actually a Table control. Don't let that fool you: the header will only print once for each page.
